title: Foundation Algebra Practice Test
description: Test your skills with repeating patterns!

questions.question: What comes next? red, blue, red, blue, red, ___
questions.explanation: This is an AB pattern with the core 'red, blue'. The pattern goes: red, blue, red, blue, red, blue. After red comes blue.

questions.question: What type of pattern is this? clap, stomp, stomp, clap, stomp, stomp, clap, stomp, stomp
questions.explanation: The core is 'clap, stomp, stomp'. The first item (clap) appears once and the second item (stomp) appears twice. This makes it an ABB pattern.

questions.question: What is the core of this pattern? star, heart, star, heart, star, heart
questions.explanation: The core is the smallest group that repeats. Here, 'star, heart' repeats three times: star, heart | star, heart | star, heart. So the core is 'star, heart'.

questions.question: What comes next? triangle, square, circle, triangle, square, circle, triangle, ___
questions.explanation: This is an ABC pattern with the core 'triangle, square, circle'. After triangle comes square. The pattern continues: triangle, square, circle.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a repeating pattern?

options.text: red, blue, red, blue, red, blue
up, down, up, down, up, down
big, small, big, small, big, small

questions.explanation: A repeating pattern has a core that repeats. 'red, blue, green, yellow, purple' has no repeating group -- each item is different. The other three all have a repeating core.

questions.question: What are the next TWO items? hop, jump, jump, hop, jump, jump, hop, ___, ___
questions.explanation: The core is 'hop, jump, jump' (ABB pattern). After hop comes jump, jump. So the next two items are jump, jump.

questions.question: What comes next in this AB pattern? big, small, big, small, big, ___
questions.explanation: This is an AB pattern with the core 'big, small'. After big comes small. The pattern alternates between big and small.

questions.question: How many items are in the core of an ABC pattern?
questions.explanation: An ABC pattern has 3 items in its core: A, B, and C. For example, 'red, yellow, blue' is the core, and these 3 items repeat.

questions.question: What type of pattern is this: sun, moon, sun, moon, sun, moon? (AB, ABB, or ABC?)
questions.explanation: Two items (sun and moon) take turns. The core is 'sun, moon' which has 2 items. Two items alternating is an AB pattern.

questions.question: In the pattern 'red, red, blue, red, red, blue', what comes after the second 'red'?
questions.explanation: The core is 'red, red, blue' (an AAB pattern). After the two reds always comes blue. So after the second red, the answer is blue.
